intro: Malacantha obtusa, commonly known as the blunt-tipped spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically oval to lance-shaped with a smooth or slightly toothed margin. The plant produces small, clustered yellowish-green flowers that are surrounded by modified leaves called cyathia, a common feature in the spurge family. It is native to regions of Africa and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Malacantha obtusa is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
